results.title: Struggle
results.creator_credit: Eureka Films, Keith Morris, Dale Butler and Peter Baroutis
results.brief_description: In an effort to salvage some land for recreational and park use in 1971, the residents of North Carlton, an inner suburb of Melbourne, came into opposition with the building contractor representing Kimberley-Clark Australia Pty Ltd. The company had proposed plans for building a warehouse for Kleenex products on the site. Unions joined forces with the residents against the building contractor, and the film shows some of those involved voicing their opinions and how events developed during the conflict. The confrontation leads to speeches, shouting, strong language, demonstrations and some violence and the increasing involvement of progressive Trade Unions in matters other than the bread-and-butter struggle. Suitable for secondary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eureka Films, Keith Morris, Dale Butler and Peter Baroutis

results.title: Structuring the learning environment (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Discusses four key points concerning the learning environment for severely and profoundly retarded students: the normalisation model; a ten point plan for increasing behaviour; the reasons why inappropriate behaviours occur; handling disruptive students

results.title: Structure within the image
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photographers Barbara Kasten and Garry Winogrand show how every photographer uses a unique structure within their work. Discusses framing, line, shape, tone and pattern and demonstrates ways to structurally improve photographs.

results.title: Structure of the atom
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
These programs explore the history and development of the model of the atom, from the hypothesis of early Greek philosophers to the wave-mechanical model of modern atomic physicists. Experiments by pioneer atomic scientists such as Bohr, Faraday, de Broglie and Rutherford are recreated through animation and their implications are discussed. The six 10 minute episodes are: 1. “The Earliest models” 2. “Smaller than smallest” 3. “The Rutherford Model” 4. “The Bohr Model” 5. “Spectra” 6.”The Wave-mechanic Model.”

results.title: Struck by lightning
results.creator_credit: Dark Horse Pictures, Terry J. Charatsis, Trevor Farrant and Jerzy Domaradzki
results.brief_description: Rennie, a middle-aged ex-teacher, now carer of people with Downs Syndrome, has come to believe that humane containment is all that can be hoped for. Pat Cannizzaro, a young idealistic social misfit, believes that intellectually disabled people have the right to full self-realisation through self-expression and social relationships. The film has been praised for its humanity and intelligence. It has also been condemned for its cynical recycling of stereotypes and failure to portray the real issues surrounding the treatment of the intellectually impaired. Cast includes Garry McDonald, Brian Vriends and Catherine McClements.
